Class GUIUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUIUtilities

  • public class GUIUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of utility methods that wrap a JOPtionPane and provide easy access to int, double, String, and boolean types.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Emily

    • Method Detail

      • getIntDialog

        public static int getIntDialog(java.lang.String prompt)
        Create an input dialog with the given prompt that returns an int value. If users are not perfect, i.e., if mistakes are made in data entry, such as entering the wrong data type, the method will break.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The instructions to the user.
        Returns:
        The int value the user enters.

      • getDoubleDialog

        public static double getDoubleDialog(java.lang.String prompt)
        Create an input dialog with the given prompt that returns a double value. If users are not perfect, i.e., if mistakes are made in data entry, such as entering the wrong data type, the method will break.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The instructions to the user.
        Returns:
        The double value the user enters.

      • getStringDialog

        public static java.lang.String getStringDialog(java.lang.String prompt)
        Create an input dialog with the given prompt that returns a String value.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The instructions to the user.
        Returns:
        The value the user enters.

      • getBooleanDialog

        public static boolean getBooleanDialog(java.lang.String prompt)
        Create an input dialog with the given prompt that returns a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The instructions to the user.
        Returns:
        The boolean value the user enters. The method compares all input to "true" (ignoring case). All other inputs will return false. Even " true" will return false. If users enter either "True" / "true" / "TRUE" / etc or "false", the value they enter will be returned. Else, the value returned will simply be false (because it will not match IgnoreCase("true")).
